newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: FOCUS- OCE UPS DIV AS TAKEOVER BOOSTS NET.
newsitem.headline: FOCUS- OCE UPS DIV AS TAKEOVER BOOSTS NET.

text.p: Photocopier maker Oce-van der Grinten NV said on Monday its 1995/96 net profit jumped 57 percent to 169.5 million guilders from 108.3 million, due in part to a major acquisition in Germany.
The company said it planned to raise its dividend to 3.00 guilders per share from 2.50 and that new product launches would contribute to a further improvement in earnings in 1996/97.
Full-year sales rose 42 percent to 4.17 billion guilders, with SNI Printing, acquired from Germany's Siemens AG last April, accounting for just under half of the increase.

SNI Printing -- bought for 900 million guilders -- posted sales of 731 million guilders from April to the end of Oce's 1995/96 financial year on November 30. Oce said SNI Printing had also made an important contribution to group profits.
Oce said sales of equipment to the engineering systems market rose by 15 percent to 1.37 billion guilders, mainly because of strong sales of high volume digital copiers.
It said digital machines now represented more than 70 percent of its sales in the engineering systems market.
Sales in the office systems market, including printers sold under Oce's own name, rose 19 percent to 2.08 billion guilders.
SNI Printing booked strong sales for its Pagestream printers which print at speeds of up to 700 pages per minute, it said.
Oce said that, barring unforeseen circumstances, it expected a further improvement in earnings in 1997.
"On the basis of its own strengths, Oce has expanded in all markets. The acquisition of SNI Printing has added a further important dimension to that expansion," the company said.
"This has established a solid basis for continued growth in sales and profitability. Further launches of machines in 1997 are expected to support that growth," it added.
Oce said it would ask shareholders to approve a change in its official name to Oce NV from the more cumbersome Oce-van der Grinten NV.
